page.title: 05BUN THROWING IN ABINGDON
page.content: In 1981 when the Prince of Wales got married, they threw buns off the top of the County Hall in Abingdon. It was quite a chilly morning. The market square was crowded, people coult catch the buns and keep them as souveniers. I was six years old and I went with my mum. The first bun throwing day was in 1760 for King George 111 coronation. The next bun throwing day was for the coronation of King George 1V in 1821. "The Chamberlain was sent to buy l,OOO penny cakes". In 1842 buns were thrown for the christening of The Prince of Wales. Nobody knows how it all started but it is a unique custom. At the celebration for the Silver Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth 11 in 1977 buns were thrown, the next celebration was for the Queen Mother's eightieth birthday in 1980. Written by Claire Pullen aged 10 years.
